class.name: ClipMapInstance
class.brief_description: A Node3D that manages the visual representation of a wandering clipmap.
class.description: ClipMapInstance creates and manages a set of mesh tiles arranged in a clipmap pattern. It automatically generates LOD rings around a center point, with proper seam handling between LOD levels. The clipmap can be repositioned each frame to follow a target (like a camera), creating the illusion of an infinite surface. Configure the [member tile_size], [member lod_levels], [member vertex_scaling], and [member material] properties, then call [method update_position] each frame.

method.name: rebuild
method.description: Forces a complete rebuild of all tile meshes. Call this after changing [member tile_size] or [member lod_levels].

method.name: update_position
method.description: Updates the clipmap center to follow the given world position. Only the X and Z components are used; the Y position is preserved from the ClipMapInstance's own position. Call this each frame with the camera or player position.

members.member: The number of LOD rings to generate around the center. More levels extend the visible range but increase mesh count.
The size of each tile in quads. Must be an even number for proper LOD seam generation. Larger tiles mean fewer draw calls but coarser detail.
Scale factor applied to all tiles. Affects the world-space size of each vertex step. Use this to control the overall density of the mesh.
